alert.note: Alert for Humphreys (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 23 at 1:22AM CST until February 26 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Nashville TN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Tennessee... Duck River Near Hurricane Mills affecting Humphreys County. For the Duck River...including Manchester, Shelbyville, Pottsville, Milltown, Columbia, Centerville, Hurricane Mills...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Duck River Near Hurricane Mills. * WHEN...From this evening to early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Agricultural land, other low lying areas, and access points along the river from Bucksnort to Taylortown, Cedar Grove, and to Bakerville Rd begin to flood. Portions of Tumbling Creek Rd east of Highway 13 begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 14.9 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 21.0 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Friday evening. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 21.0 feet on 03/21/1961. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 730 PM CST.
